intro: Petrogeton, commonly known as the rock nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which often have a waxy coating. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid or semi-arid environments. Petrogeton species are often found in regions such as the Mediterranean, North Africa, and parts of the Middle East. These plants produce small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences.
